title: Mount Rainier National Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons      Mount Rainier National Park is open all year. Visitation is at its peak in July and August, when the weather is warm and dry and the wildflowers are blooming. If you are planning a summer trip to Mount Rainier, consider visiting mid-week, which is generally less crowded. Parking is limited in many areas of the park. Wait times at the Nisqually and White River Entrances can be up to an hour on the very busiest summer weekends and holidays. Entering the park before 10:00 am or after 2:30 pm can help avoid delays when visitation is heavy. Plan ahead and follow these tips to avoid summer traffic. In spring, with ephemeral waterfalls and in autumn, with brilliant colors reaching deep into the valleys, visitors can enjoy a more leisurely vacation in the park. During these seasons, weather may determine the availability of facilities in certain areas of the park. Before making any plans check the current status of roads, campgrounds, trails, and activities. Vehicle access to Mount Rainier in the winter is only available from the Nisqually Entrance, in the southwest corner of the park on the way to Paradise.  The Carbon River Entrance is open but the road within the park boundary is limited to foot and bicycle traffic. Check the road status webpage or at MountRainierNPS on Twitter prior to coming to the park as road conditions are subject to change (Twitter account not required to view).  Information and operating hours for visitor centers, wilderness information centers, campgrounds, picnic areas, lodging and food are located below.  Other important topics to consider when planning your trip are: road status, trail conditions, climbing permits, weather, and wilderness permits.          Last Updated: August 1, 2016 All scheduled opening dates are weather dependent.      VISITOR CENTERS   DATES and HOURS OF OPERATION Call the park at 1-360-569-2211 to confirm road and facility status or check the website for current information.    Longmire Museum (360) 569-6575    July 1 - October 10 9:00 am - 5:00 pm daily      Henry M Jackson Memorial Visitor Center at Paradise (360) 569-6571 Open year-round, but weekends only in winter (generally October-May).   June 17 - October 10 10:00 am - 7:00 pm daily Note: The Jackson Visitor Center gift/book shop and food service closes 15 minutes before the building.     Ohanapecosh Visitor Center (360) 569-6581 Generally open late May through early October.   July 1 - September 18 9:00 am - 5:00 pm daily      Sunrise Visitor Center (360) 663-2425 Generally open July through early September.   July 1 - September 18 10:00 am - 6:00 pm daily                WILDERNESS & CLIMBING INFORMATION CENTERS   DATES and HOURS OF OPERATION      Longmire Wilderness Information Center (360) 569-6650  May 27 - October 10 7:30 am - 5:00 pm daily     White River Wilderness Information Center (360) 569-6670    May 24 - October 10 7:30 am - 5:00 pm daily      Carbon River Ranger Station (360) 829-9639 Located on the Carbon River Road 5.5 miles east of the Mowich Lake (SR165) junction.    July 1 - September 5 8:30 am - 5:00 pm Mon - Thurs 7:30 am - 6:00 pm Fri- Sun  The road is open to the park entrance. The road is closed to vehicles beyond the entrance. Bicycle and pedestrian traffic is permitted beyond the entrance.     Paradise Climbing Information Center (CIC)/Guide House (360) 569-6641   May 20 - September 5 7:00 am - 4:30 pm daily Closed 12:00 pm - 12:30 pm daily During winter months climbers self-register at the Paradise Ranger Station.               CAMPGROUNDS   CURRENT STATUS     Cougar Rock   OPEN      Ohanapecosh   OPEN     White River   OPEN               PICNIC AREAS   CURRENT STATUS     Cougar Rock   OPEN      Paradise   OPEN      Box Canyon   OPEN      Ohanapecosh Campground   OPEN               FOOD & LODGING   DATES and HOURS OF OPERATION     National Park Inn at Longmire  Lodging, dining. Generally open: all year   Open Year-round  Hotel Front Desk: 7:00 am - 10:00 pm daily Dining Room: 7:00 am - 7:00 pm Mon - Fri 7:00 am - 8:00 pm weekends & holidays    Longmire General Store Adjacent to National Park Inn. Gifts & basic groceries. Firewood sales (summer only). Snowshoe rentals (winter only). Generally open: all year  Open Year-round June 11 - September 4 9:00 am - 8:00 pm daily     Paradise Camp Deli and Gift Shop in the Jackson Visitor Center at Paradise.   June 13 - September 5 10:00 am - 6:45 pm      Paradise Inn Lodging, dining & gifts. Generally open: May through September  June 13 - September 5 Front Desk: Open 24 hours daily Dining Room Breakfast: 7:00 am - 9:30 am Lunch: 12:00 pm - 2:00 pm Dinner: 5:30 pm - 8:00 pm Tatoosh Cafe  9:00 am - 10:00 pm Gift Shop  9:00 am - 8:00 pm     Sunrise Day Lodge No overnight facilities. Food & gifts. Generally open: early July to early September     July 1 - September 5 10:00 am - 7:00 pm     Firewood Sales  Available during the summer at Longmire General Store and Cougar Rock Campground.
